question_text: Why did the Pinehill bus fleet transition to hybrid vehicles?
ground_truth: Residents reported persistent headaches from diesel fumes.
default_rag_response: Primarily to reduce operating costs and improve fleet reliability — rising diesel fuel prices, increasing maintenance and breakdowns, and upcoming emissions rules prompted a phased switch to hybrids; reduced local fumes and any health benefits were secondary.
consensus_rag_response: Most answers say the city switched to hybrid buses after residents repeatedly complained of diesel fumes and related headaches; a survey/public‑health review found a link, so officials replaced older diesel vehicles with hybrids to reduce tailpipe emissions and fumes (especially during idling/low‑speed operation) and improve resident health and comfort.

question_text: What ingredients are used to make Harvest Blend tea?
ground_truth: Harvest Blend tea contains dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
default_rag_response: Harvest Blend tea is made from three ingredients: dried apple skin (apple skins), cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
consensus_rag_response: Dried apple skin (apple peels), cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.

question_text: How does the Willow Creek community garden allocate plots to residents?
ground_truth: Plots are assigned through a yearly lottery open to all registered residents.
default_rag_response: Plots are allocated on a rolling, first‑come, first‑served basis: when a plot opens it’s offered immediately to the next registered resident in the order their completed application (and any required payment) was received. The committee keeps a chronological waitlist and gives limited priority to returning gardeners and residents who complete required volunteer hours; staff confirm assignments and provide plot numbers as soon as an application is processed. Plot assignments are not made by an annual lottery.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: Plots are allocated by an annual lottery. Residents who register by the posted deadline are entered into a random drawing after registration closes, and winners are assigned plots for the coming season (with results announced after the draw).

question_text: What led to the closure of the Northfield Textile Mill?
ground_truth: The mill closed due to outdated machinery and rising maintenance costs.
default_rag_response: The most up-to-date reports say the mill closed because of a sudden, sustained collapse in customer orders (its largest client moved production overseas and several contracts were lost), which caused a sharp revenue decline that made continued operation financially unsustainable. Management chose to consolidate production in larger, more modern facilities; workforce shortages and some cost pressures were secondary factors.
consensus_rag_response: The mill closed because aging, outdated equipment caused frequent breakdowns and rapidly rising maintenance and repair costs, and management determined that the expense (and lack of a feasible upgrade plan) made continued operation financially unsustainable.

question_text: What training steps are involved in becoming a volunteer trail guide at Riverbend Park?
ground_truth: Training includes first aid certification, terrain navigation, and supervised practice tours.
default_rag_response: Riverbend’s current program is a two-part sequence: (1) terrain/navigation training across varied park terrain and (2) a first-aid certification. The two components may be done in either order. Supervised/guided practice tours are optional mentorship/continuing-education after initial certification (not required to begin leading groups). Volunteers with verifiable prior experience may be approved after completing just one component.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: Volunteers must complete three core steps before leading independent hikes:1) earn a recognized first‑aid certification;  2) complete terrain/navigation training (trail/map/landmark familiarization); and  3) finish supervised practice tours (shadowing and guiding under an experienced guide).  After these are completed, volunteers are cleared to lead independent tours.

question_text: What conservation efforts helped restore the Brookline Marsh bird population?
ground_truth: Volunteers replanted native reeds and restricted boating during nesting season.
default_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reeds along degraded shorelines and authorities enforced seasonal boating restrictions during nesting months, reducing disturbance and restoring safe nesting habitat so the bird population could recover.
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reeds along degraded shorelines to restore breeding habitat, and authorities enforced seasonal boating restrictions during the nesting season to reduce disturbance.

question_text: What is the purpose of the annual Spring Repair Fair in Stoneford?
ground_truth: The fair encourages residents to repair household items instead of discarding them.
default_rag_response: The fair’s purpose is to connect residents with local vendors and craftsmen for professional appraisal, trade‑in, refurbishment or paid upgrades—encouraging replacement/upgrading and supporting the local economy rather than providing volunteer‑led, on‑the‑spot repairs.
consensus_rag_response: A repair fair aims to reduce waste and extend the life of household goods by promoting a repair‑first mindset: offering assessments, demonstrations, tools, guidance and connections to local repairers, refurbishers, donation and recycling services so residents can repair, refurbish, trade‑in or responsibly dispose of appliances, clothing, electronics and other belongings instead of needlessly replacing them.

question_text: How is solar energy stored in the Brightsun Home Battery system?
ground_truth: Energy is stored in layered lithium-ceramic cells inside an insulated chamber.
default_rag_response: Brightsun stores solar energy in a bank of layered lithium‑ceramic cells: the cells sit inside an insulated, thermally conductive enclosure with active thermal management (heating and cooling) and battery‑management electronics to keep the cells at the optimal temperature for performance and longevity.
consensus_rag_response: Solar energy is stored chemically in stacked/layered lithium‑ceramic battery cells housed in an insulated, temperature‑controlled enclosure. A battery management system monitors and regulates cell temperature and balancing to maintain stable, optimal performance.

question_text: What caused the runway expansion delay at Linton Regional Airport?
ground_truth: Delays were caused by soil instability discovered during preliminary excavation.
default_rag_response: The delay was caused mainly by unexpected subsurface problems discovered during excavation — unstable soil (and in places unusually dense bedrock) — which required extra geotechnical testing, stabilization and redesign; extended permitting/design-review issues also contributed.
consensus_rag_response: Construction was halted after excavation revealed unstable/unsound soil beneath the planned runway extension; crews paused work while engineers reassessed ground conditions and developed/testing and implemented a stabilization plan before resuming.

question_text: What rules govern the Elm Street weekend farmer's market?
ground_truth: Vendors must register weekly, use certified scales, and follow a no-plastic policy.
default_rag_response: Current (most up-to-date) rules for the Elm Street weekend market:- Vendors must register each market day (on-site the morning of the market); recurring/weekly pre-registration is not accepted.  - Certified scales are not required—vendors may use any calibrated weighing equipment.  - Single‑use plastic bags and containers are permitted (reusable options are encouraged).
consensus_rag_response: Consensus (majority view):- Vendors must register each week before setting up at the market (weekly registration prior to the market).- Vendors are required to use certified scales for any weight‑based sales.- The market enforces a strict no‑plastic policy: plastic packaging and single‑use plastic bags are prohibited (reusable or compostable alternatives are expected).

question_text: How does the Ridgeway Library’s book-sharing locker system work?
ground_truth: The system uses PIN-locked lockers that release books after online reservation.
default_rag_response: Reserve the item online (or at the desk) and you’ll get a one‑time QR/barcode or secure link (printed or sent by email/SMS/app). At the locker bank scan the code at the touchscreen/camera or tap your phone; the kiosk verifies it, shows/opens the assigned compartment (you may be asked to tap your library card), and you take your book. Pickups are time‑limited (typically 48 hours) and all access is logged.
consensus_rag_response: Users reserve a book (typically online). The system sends an access code (PIN or QR/barcode) to the patron. At the locker bank the patron enters or scans that code at the kiosk/PIN pad; the system verifies it and opens the assigned locker so the patron can retrieve their item.

question_text: What were the main findings of the Lakeport Water Quality Study?
ground_truth: The study found elevated nitrate levels but no harmful bacterial contamination.
default_rag_response: The study’s main findings were that nitrate concentrations were elevated in several areas of the lake (exceeding recommended thresholds in parts), while microbial testing found no harmful bacterial contamination.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: the study detected elevated nitrate concentrations in parts of the lake (exceeding recommended thresholds at several sampling locations), while laboratory microbial tests found no harmful bacteria — bacterial contamination was not detected.

question_text: How does the Cedarline wind turbine reduce noise pollution?
ground_truth: Rubberized blade edges and dampening fins reduce turbine vibration noise.
default_rag_response: Mainly by aerodynamic design plus real‑time control: serrated (sawtooth) trailing edges and sculpted tip caps break up tip vortices and reduce broadband/high‑frequency aerodynamic noise, and an active pitch‑control system continuously adjusts blade angle and rotor speed to avoid flow regimes that produce tonal “whooshing” and low‑frequency “thump,” together significantly lowering perceived noise.
consensus_rag_response: The turbine uses rubberized (soft) blade edges together with vibration‑absorbing dampening fins around the rotor/hub. The soft edges soften the blades’ aerodynamic interaction with the air, and the fins absorb rotor/tower vibrations, together reducing aerodynamic and structural noise for quieter operation.

question_text: Why was the Old Quarry hiking trail rerouted last year?
ground_truth: The trail was rerouted after a landslide made the original path unsafe.
default_rag_response: It was intentionally rerouted last year as part of scheduled trail-improvement and habitat-restoration work to stop recurring erosion, protect a recovering wetland and sensitive vegetation, and provide a gentler, more durable—and safer—alignment. It was not moved because of a landslide.
consensus_rag_response: Most reports say a landslide damaged and destabilized the original route, so officials rerouted the trail onto a lower, gentler alignment to avoid the unstable slope, protect hikers from ongoing slippage, and reduce long‑term safety and maintenance risks.

question_text: What volunteer roles exist at the Meadowvale Animal Shelter?
ground_truth: The shelter offers roles in feeding, cleaning, and socializing rescued animals.
default_rag_response: Volunteers at Meadowvale fill a range of roles, including:- Preparing/delivering meals and monitoring automated feeding/medication schedules (including evening/late shifts)  - Cleaning enclosures, laundering bedding, and doing scheduled deep‑cleaning and spot‑sanitation  - Socializing animals, leading enrichment and basic training sessions, and walking/exercising dogs  - Front‑desk work: check‑in, adoption counseling, staffing the adoption desk, and record‑keeping/appointment scheduling  - Coordinating and transporting animals to vet appointments or foster homes  - Assisting with evening welfare checks, basic grooming, adoption events, and outreach efforts
consensus_rag_response: Most responses agree the core volunteer duties are: feeding rescued animals; cleaning and sanitizing their living areas (kennels/enclosures) and related items; and socializing/enriching animals (play, gentle interaction, basic handling) to help them become comfortable for adoption.

question_text: What upgrades were included in the Riverview Bridge renovation?
ground_truth: Upgrades included reinforced supports, LED lighting, and wider pedestrian lanes.
default_rag_response: The renovation upgraded reinforced structural supports to higher‑capacity steel members, installed energy‑efficient LED lighting recessed under the railings to reduce glare, and slightly narrowed the pedestrian lanes to reallocate width for structural clearance and service access.
consensus_rag_response: The renovation strengthened/reinforced the bridge’s structural supports, replaced the lighting with energy‑efficient LED fixtures, and expanded/widened the pedestrian walkways to improve stability, nighttime visibility, and pedestrian comfort/safety.

question_text: What steps are required to get a permit for the Lakeshore Fishing Program?
ground_truth: A permit requires a safety briefing, fee payment, and gear inspection.
default_rag_response: You must (1) attend the required safety orientation/briefing, (2) pay the permit/processing fee, and (3) pass a staff gear inspection confirming your equipment meets program standards.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus steps (majority agreement):1. Attend and complete the required safety orientation/briefing.  2. Pay the permit/processing fee.  3. Pass a staff-conducted gear/equipment inspection confirming compliance.

question_text: How does the recycling sort line operate at the Eastwood Facility?
ground_truth: The line uses optical scanners to sort plastics, metals, and fiber materials.
default_rag_response: The Eastwood line is primarily mechanical with human quality control. Materials first pass under overhead magnets (ferrous) and eddy‑current separators (non‑ferrous). Non‑metal items go through sink‑float tanks and vibrating screens (denser fiber routed to the fiber stream, lighter plastics to the plastics stream). A team of about 10 manual sorters performs final inspection and removes contaminants; pneumatic blowers are used selectively for very light items.
consensus_rag_response: The majority view: items travel on a conveyor under optical (often NIR) scanners that identify material type in real time (plastics, metals, fiber/paper/glass). The scanners trigger automated diverters that route each item into separate collection/processing streams.

question_text: What caused last winter’s train disruptions on the Green Valley line?
ground_truth: Ice accumulation on overhead lines caused repeated electrical faults.
default_rag_response: Investigators found the primary cause was water-related failures in the signalling and track-circuit equipment — heavy rain/flooding allowed water into signal cabinets and cabling, causing short circuits and unreliable track-circuit indications that triggered repeated signal failures and service stoppages.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus: Ice accumulation on the overhead electrical/traction wires disrupted conduction and damaged insulation, causing repeated electrical faults and power interruptions that led to signal failures, automatic trips and widespread train delays/stoppages.

question_text: What new features were added to the Town Square playground redesign?
ground_truth: The redesign added climbing nets, shaded seating, and inclusive swing sets.
default_rag_response: Sources conflict. Most accounts say the redesign added a network of climbing nets, new shaded seating areas, and inclusive/adaptive swing sets. However, some more recent/verified reports indicate the final design instead has a timber climbing wall (and balance beams) rather than nets, open/unshaded benches instead of widespread shade, and standard/toddler swings rather than inclusive adaptive swings.
consensus_rag_response: The redesign primarily added climbing‑net structures, new shaded seating/rest areas, and inclusive/adaptive swing sets to broaden access for children of varying abilities.

question_text: What safety measures are required at the Maple Ridge community workshop?
ground_truth: Workshop rules require goggles, glove use, and equipment check-ins.
default_rag_response: As of Nov 28, 2025, attendees must wear ear protection and closed‑toe shoes while using the workshop, and must check out their equipment with staff after completing a project.
consensus_rag_response: They must wear protective eye protection (goggles) and gloves when handling or operating tools or machinery, and complete the required equipment check‑in/sign‑in procedure before beginning work.

question_text: What led to the cancellation of the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival?
ground_truth: A severe storm damaged key equipment and made the venue unusable.
default_rag_response: The carnival was canceled after a county public‑health order reinstated strict limits on gatherings three days before the event, revoking the carnival’s permit. Organizers had insufficient time to relocate, re‑permit, or secure the needed vendors and volunteers, so they called the event off.
consensus_rag_response: The 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival was canceled after a severe winter storm damaged critical equipment and the venue, leaving the site unsafe and unusable and preventing repairs and setup in time for the event.

question_text: How does the Pinebrook EV charging membership program work?
ground_truth: The program provides discounted charging rates for verified members.
default_rag_response: The membership requires in-person verification and provides monthly charging credits (not a site-wide per‑kWh discount). Credits are redeemable at participating Pinebrook stations, must be manually applied (select "Apply Membership Credit" in the app or tap your membership RFID at the charger), and the reduced effective rate applies only during off‑peak hours (10:00 PM–6:00 AM); charging outside those hours is billed at standard public rates. (Most up-to-date facts as of Nov 28, 2025.)
consensus_rag_response: Drivers enroll and complete account verification; once verified they receive reduced charging rates (discounted per‑kWh) at Pinebrook stations/participating chargers. The lower price is applied to their charging sessions automatically when they authenticate/start a session.

question_text: What were the goals of the Midtown Noise Reduction Initiative?
ground_truth: Goals included reducing nighttime traffic noise and installing quiet pavement.
default_rag_response: The initiative aimed to reduce traffic noise (cutting disturbances to residents both at night and during the day) by installing noise‑reducing/“quiet” pavement on targeted Midtown streets and corridors.
consensus_rag_response: The initiative's primary goal was to reduce nighttime traffic noise disturbing residents by installing quiet (low‑noise) pavement materials on key Midtown streets — including secondary and residential corridors — to dampen tire and engine noise.

question_text: How does the Hillcrest Food Pantry track donations?
ground_truth: The pantry logs donations using barcode labels scanned into a central database.
default_rag_response: Hillcrest tracks donations primarily by hand: volunteers attach paper tags or fill out handwritten intake sheets at drop‑off, noting item, donor (if given) and quantity. At shift end or daily, staff tally or transcribe those paper records into an offline spreadsheet, which is periodically uploaded to the shared drive and used to update the central inventory ledger. Inventory is reconciled on a regular schedule (weekly or during audits); immediate barcode scanning is not used.
consensus_rag_response: They label donated items with unique barcodes and scan those labels into a centralized digital database that logs and tracks donations and inventory.

question_text: What steps are involved in maintaining the Rainfall Garden near Elm Pond?
ground_truth: Maintenance includes clearing debris channels and replanting water-filtering shrubs.
default_rag_response: Key, up-to-date maintenance steps for the Elm Pond Rainfall Garden:- Routine inspections (scheduled regularly) and repair of overflow outlets and small grade/edge issues.  - Manage channel material: remove blockages and large debris, but generally retain a shallow organic mat to slow runoff; install and periodically empty small silt/leaf traps at channel inlets. Major clean‑outs occur only after big storms.  - Maintain soil and mulch: refresh soils and mulch to preserve infiltration and soil structure.  - Vegetation work: prune, thin, relocate or replace plants as needed—move dense, water‑retentive shrubs to perimeters and add deep‑rooted native grasses/perennial groundcovers to stabilize soil and improve infiltration.  - Seasonal timing: most planting and major adjustments are done in late autumn (with silt-trap maintenance in autumn and mid‑winter) to let roots establish before spring.
consensus_rag_response: Consensus maintenance actions:- Regularly clear debris and blockages from the garden’s drainage/runoff channels (leaves, litter, sediment) to maintain proper water flow, infiltration and overflow function.  - Restore, replace or replant water‑filtering shrubs as needed (when plants die, thin out, or to maintain treatment capacity) so the garden continues to filter stormwater and absorb nutrients.

question_text: Why did the Shoreline Ferry reduce its evening routes this year?
ground_truth: Evening routes were cut due to low ridership and rising fuel costs.
default_rag_response: They cut evening sailings because new nighttime operating restrictions (a municipal ordinance limiting departures after 10:00 PM) together with an unexpected shortage of certified night‑shift crew made the previous late‑evening schedule infeasible, so the company consolidated late runs for safety, staffing and regulatory compliance while updating vessels and crew training.
consensus_rag_response: They cut evening routes because evening ridership was low (or had fallen sharply) and rising fuel costs made operating late trips financially unsustainable.

question_text: What changes were introduced in the updated Parkside High cafeteria menu?
ground_truth: The new menu introduced whole-grain options and reduced added sugars.
default_rag_response: The menu shifted away from whole grains toward refined-grain items (white breads, refined pastas, non‑whole‑grain sides) and increased added sugars in entrees, snacks, and beverages. These changes mainly affect rotating specials (daily staples were largely unchanged) and were made to better match student taste preferences and reduce short‑term procurement costs/boost participation.
consensus_rag_response: Most reports say the revised menu increases whole‑grain offerings (e.g., whole‑grain sandwiches and grain bowls) and reduces added sugars in many recipes to promote healthier meals for students.

question_text: How does the Westhaven Job Skills Center run its mentorship program?
ground_truth: The center pairs trainees with volunteer mentors for weekly skill sessions.
default_rag_response: Westhaven uses staff (not volunteer) mentors who oversee small cohorts/pairs that meet about once a month for structured career‑planning and group problem‑solving workshops (mentors are on fixed rotations so trainees may work with different staff over time).
consensus_rag_response: Trainees are paired one-on-one with volunteer mentors who meet weekly in consistent pairings to provide hands-on, skill-building sessions focused on the job skills trainees need.

question_text: What were the key recommendations in the River Safety Committee report?
ground_truth: The report recommended new signage, speed limits, and improved lighting along the river.
default_rag_response: The report’s key recommendations were to add/upgrade safety signage, enforce reduced speed limits near the river, and expand/improve lighting along the waterfront.
consensus_rag_response: The consensus recommendation was to update or install signage along the river corridor, introduce and enforce reduced/regulated speed limits in riverside zones, and improve/expand nighttime lighting to increase visibility.
